title: How to Sew Curtains for a Four Poster Bed

steps.headline: Understand approximate measurements.
steps.description: Twin beds are 3' x 6.25'. Double beds are 4.5' x 6.25'. Queen beds are 6' x 6.5'. King beds are 6.5' x 6.5'.

steps.headline: Measure the length and height of each side of the bed frame.
steps.description: Gathered curtains are usually 1.5 to 2.0 times wider than the area they'll need to cover. Add two inches for a one-inch ruffle at the top of the curtain. Add the width of the curtain rod plus a 1/4 inch for movement within a rod pocket. Add four inches for the lower hem. Add an inch and a half width for each hem at "both" sides of a panel.

steps.headline: Sew lengths of fabric together to enlarge the width of each panel.
Hem the sides of each panel.
steps.description: Turn over and iron the edge of the fabric twice, to form a one-inch hemline. Stitch it in place.

steps.headline: Fold the top of each panel.
steps.description: Turn over and iron a quarter-inch of fabric. Turn over the fabric a second time. This width should accommodate the width of your rod plus the height of a ruffle. If you do not want a ruffle, just accommodate for the rod.

steps.headline: Stitch the top of each panel.
steps.description: Stitch the hem in place. Place another row of horizontal stitching between the hem and the top of the panel, accommodating for the width of the rod and ruffle.

steps.headline: Hem the lower panels.
steps.description: Turn over and iron a quarter-inch of fabric. Turn over the fabric a second time to your desired measurement. Stitch it in place by hand for a nice finished look.

steps.headline: Slide the rods into the pockets and hang your curtains.
Make tiebacks.

With right sides together, stitch along the open edge, to form a long tube. Attach a safety pin to one end of the tube. Pass the pin through the tube, while pulling the fabric right side out. Tuck in a half-inch of fabric, at each end of a tie and stitch it together by hand. Iron the ties flat. Place a tie around the bed post, gather the panel into the tie and make a bow.
